abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Rural Health
            Project for China is to increased and more equitable access
            to quality health services, improved financial protection,
            and better management of public health threats in pilot
            provinces and counties, with lessons to support reforms in
            non-project areas. This restructuring is to: (a) extend the
            closing date (as a first extension) by one year from
            December 31, 2013 to December 31, 2014; this will allow
            sufficient time for the project to complete the latest
            pilots, carry out evaluations of the new pilots, and
            disseminate and roll out to non-piloting areas; (b) remove
            the reference of National Validation Panel (NPV) in the loan
            agreement, and replace it with the National Expert Panel
            (NEP) as the NEP has been carrying out this function over
            the course of the project; and (c) revise the definition of
            indicator 17 to better align and assess the progress of
            implementation on the ground.
